programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: The pufferfish is poisonous and if eaten by a human, the venom can affect one's diaphragm and can cause death by suffocation. And, in just 5 seconds, the hummingbird can flap its wings 350 times. Plus, the importance of the Elephant in the Serengeti.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: This week we visit South Carolina. Philippe joins the Department of Natural Resources to tag tiger sharks in Port Royal Sound. Then we head inland for a hike to find wild venus fly traps. From there it's back to the shoreline of Port Royal Sound to examine ecosystem indicators through three different species of crab. Finally Congaree National Park is home to the largest hardwood forest in the US.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: This week we head to the beautiful landscape of Glacier National Park. Philippe heads out to uncover insect fossils dating back 45 million years. Then we look at the intricate geology of the park itself. From there we track one of the most important food sources of the park - wild huckleberries. And then we join a group of students participating in a citizen science expedition.

programme.desc: Mary is devastated that Halloween has been canceled by the city, so Darlene and Becky enlist Jackie and the rest of the family to create an unforgettable experience.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene isolates herself from her co-workers at Wellman Plastics, leaving them with the impression she is an elitist snob.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: It's Beverly Rose's first birthday -- but it's not all cake and candles -- when Becky and Emilio disagree on what kind of party they should have.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene's friendship with a manager at Wellman Plastics lands her in an awkward situation; Louise's brother tries to win over Jackie.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris's job is in jeopardy after joining a protest she strongly believes in, leading to tense discussions within the family.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Ben's mom arrives after an unexpected death and unveils shocking information from the past; Becky and Emilio spend more time together.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris brings home her new friend, Josh, leaving the family questioning his intentions; Becky and Ben's attempt to build a closet stirs up family drama.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene earns a promotion at Wellman Plastics, while Ben decides on a new career path; Jackie tries an herbal tea. and it leads to an emotional revelation.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Chuck's new purchase of a boat creates a rift; Darlene hires her first assistant at Wellman's Plastics but soon realizes she is anything but helpful.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene starts to feel the pressures of her new job; Dan attempts to help Ben out at the hardware store, but the two don't always agree on how to run the business.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark is convinced he has COVID-19; Becky and Harris team up to confront Josh, who has been 'ghosting' Harris.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan feels helpless when Louise refuses to let him put himself at risk for her; when Jackie learns the competing restaurants are posting negative reviews.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Becky meets up with an old friend and feels pressured to impress him; Dan questions his position at the hardware store, leading to a massive fight between him and Ben.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Becky is working double shifts and taking classes at the community college, resulting in less time with her daughter; Dan decides to foster an elderly dog.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene learns shocking news about a friend; the Conners family comes together to help someone close to them.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan encounters a surprise visitor who shares some unsolicited advice, leaving him feeling guilty; Darlene welcomes a new employee to Wellman Plastics.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark is stressed and exhausted from studying for an important entrance exam, so Darlene steps in to help, but her plan backfires.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene makes a decision about her trip to Hawaii, leading to a heated encounter with Barb; Becky gives a presentation on addiction to Mark's class.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Two proposals bring big changes to the Conner family; Jackie uses her Jeopardy infamy to her advantage.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners continue to deal with the pandemic while navigating breakups and newfound sobriety, all while planning an upcoming wedding.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: After Ben declines Darlene's proposal, she starts to ponder why she tends to be so negative in life, prompting her to start a journey of self-discovery, which leads to Pastor Phil.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Part of Becky's recovery program mandates she make amends with people she has lied to over the years, leading her to meet up again with a former high school friend.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: It's Dan and Louise's wedding day, but it's a far-from-perfect, especially when a weather report forecasts that a tornado is headed for Lanford creating chaos and surprises.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners are ready for Halloween, despite a leaky roof that forces Dan and Louise to cancel their honeymoon

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene worries about Mark making friends at his new school; Mark turns to Ben for advice; Becky finds herself thriving in college and starts thinking about her future plans.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Jackie devises an offbeat plan to serve the customers at The Lunch Box, it's anything but smooth; Dan begins to sell furniture to make room for his new bride and her things.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: As Louise starts to move in, Dan decides to sell the furniture he bought for Roseanne when they were married; he soon finds parting with the furniture harder than he thought.

programme.desc: Darlene brings Nick to the hardware store, where they run into Ben, who invites Nick to join him at The Lunch Box to watch a Bears game.

programme.desc: The Conners celebrate Mark when he makes Dean's List at his new magnet school; Jackie continues to navigate her relationship with Neville.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene continues to navigate her breakup with Ben; Dan offers to talk with Aldo's dad when he doesn't approve of Harris and Aldo's relationship.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark returns to public school and finds it hard to fit in; Darlene isn't happy when she finds out what Mark's doing to make extra cash for college.

programme.desc: The family is locked down in their home due to a shooting incident in the neighborhood.

programme.desc: When Becky outs her relationship with Professor Davis, it's his erratic behavior that sends Becky down a path to reevaluate their relationship.

programme.desc: Darlene searches for a home that she and Becky can afford; after an attempt to boost business at The Lunch Box goes awry.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A live boa constrictor wrapped around a man's arm is biting his wrist and won't let go.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A woman is dragged out of a house fire and has a heart attack in the ER.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER: Baby 911
programme.desc: Parents bring in a young woman with stomach pain, but they don't know she is pregnant.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A man is impaled in the abdomen by a stiletto heel. A seemingly healthy outdoorsman has a series of seizures.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A newlywed's hand gets stuck in an appliance and a woman appears to only have blood flow to half of her brain.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A man's head is impaled by a trophy deer's antlers, a nurse's ex brings his new girlfriend to the ER and more.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER: Baby 911
programme.desc: Parents bring in a young woman with stomach pain, but they don't know she is pregnant.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A surfer is impaled between the legs by the fin of his surfboard.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A teenage girl is impaled through the neck on an iron fence; a patient is convinced he's turning into a vampire; a first-year attending physician stands up to a room full of senior specialists to save the life of a critically ill pregnant woman.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A man who's been smashed by a dumpster barely clings to life. A nun and a prostitute come into the ER.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A patient with a headache begins seizing, a wrestler has been vomiting for five days and more.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A fishing lure embedded in a man's face turns out to be the least of his problems.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A woman's face-lift goes wrong, a hospital chaplain's sudden personality change baffles the ER staff and more.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A psychiatric patient has an extreme love of pudding. A patient may be allergic to his girlfriend.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A woman is dragged out of a house fire and has a heart attack in the ER.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: An unconscious woman is bleeding internally. A man with a 4-day erection needs extraordinary help.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A circus sword-swallower suffers from a persistent case of hiccups; a mother and daughter mysteriously collapse in the ER; a woman loses control of her legs at her daughter's graduation.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A dialysis patient is bleeding and doctors can't get it to stop. A naked man falls onto a cactus.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A man is impaled in the abdomen by a stiletto heel. A seemingly healthy outdoorsman has a series of seizures.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A grown man suddenly begins acting bizarrely like a child, a wheezing woman has a breathing problem and more.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Two patients arrive at the ER with bizarre fishing injuries; a martial arts instructor suffers abdominal pains; teenage victims of a car crash fill a small ER.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: From extraordinary challenges to outrageous predicaments, nurses tell true medical stories from their unique perspectives.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A patient comes in with progressing paralysis, a boy is crushed by an ATV and more.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A man dressed as Santa is near death and his wife asks to harvest his semen.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A pregnant ER doctor is endangered by a seemingly invincible violent patient.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A young man has a 2-inch pipe through his head. A young bride is bleeding uncontrollably.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A man crashes his car into a cow. A woman has a stiletto heel jammed into her cheek.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A woman risks losing her finger after trying on an engagement ring, a body builder can't breathe and more.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A young woman is rushed to the ER after being bitten on the face by a dog.

If jumping a revolving arm while balancing on a pedestal above water isnt enough for you then youll love this weeks Sweeper. Contestants are armed with Dodgeballs, to be deployed at each other, creating horrific hits and spectacular spills. The Dizzy Dummy claims its first victim as Dummy Tummy rejects a contestant and the Wipeout Zone becomes a battle of young and old.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: World-renowned chef Gordon Ramsay explores new territory in Ramsay's Costa del Nightmares, a four part series that sees him travel to Europe's holiday hotspots. First up is Mayfair, with a prime location on the busy seafront in Fuengirola, Costa del Sol. The restaurant was set up 28 years ago by 68 year old Londoner Pat and her husband of 45 years, Jack. The good news is that Fuengirola is one of the only towns in Spain that has actually seen an increase in tourists since the recession with 1 and half million Brits visiting last year alone; the bad news is that Mayfair isn't benefitting. With thousands of hungry sun seekers right on its doorstep, the restaurant should be raking it in - but the place is totally empty.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: World-renowned chef Gordon Ramsay explores new territory in Ramsay's Costa del Nightmares, a four part series that sees him travel to Europe's holiday hotspots. Episode two sees Gordon tackle struggling Le Deck restaurant in Capbreton, a popular coastal town in South West France. British owners Tim and Debbie emigrated to France 28 years ago, where they met as holiday reps. Since then they've poured blood, sweat and tears into opening 3 ski restaurants in the Alps. With the arrival of their children, they set up home by the coast to enjoy the summer months together as a family. But unable to sit still, Tim launched Le Deck three years ago. Far from being a hobby, the restaurant has taken over his life.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: World-renowned chef Gordon Ramsay explores new territory in Ramsay's Costa del Nightmares, a four part series that sees him travel to Europe's holiday hotspots. Episode 3 sees Gordon travel to the stunning whitewashed mountain village of Gaucin, half an hour from the Costa del Sol. In a series first, Gordon is tackling a brand new up-market start up restaurant, La Granada Divino, it's only been open for 8 weeks but is already heading for disaster. Owned by architect Milan and former model Gina, they have never run a restaurant and have sunk their savings and retirement fund in to the place.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: World-renowned chef Gordon Ramsay explores new territory in Ramsay's Costa del Nightmares, a four part series that sees him travel to Europe's holiday hotspots. This final episode in the series takes Gordon to the Costa Blanca and a sleepy village that's home to Quelcutti's restaurant and bar, run by the Quelcutti family. Former London cabbie Del and his wife Sue emigrated to Spain 10 years ago with their three children: Joe, Terry and daughter Ruby. The plan was to retire and live the dream while using their retirement money to set up a business for their kids to run. Unfortunately, the kids are running the business into the ground.

programme.title: Raging Sharks
programme.desc: A bizarre outbreak of shark attacks terrorizes the crew of an underwater outpost years after an alien space vessel crashed in the Bermuda Triangle.

programme.title: Eye See You
programme.desc: After witnessing a brutal scene on the job, a shaken cop checks into a rehab clinic, where he finds his fellow patients are being murdered one by one.

programme.title: Living Dark: The Story of Ted the Caver
programme.desc: Based on an internet legend, the tale of reunited brothers traces their descent into a cave, as they confront the nightmare that killed their father.

programme.title: Maneater
programme.desc: When an escaped Bengal tiger terrorizes a small Appalachian town, its up to the local sheriff, a game-hunter, and a gifted boy to stop the creature.

programme.title: Body Count
programme.desc: A fun group of college kids, led by two alpha males and a wild blonde, see their Colorado wilderness trip become a horrific murder spree by a stalker.

programme.title: Maniac Cop III: Badge of Silence
programme.desc: A young female cop is framed for murder. She falls in love with the Maniac Cop, who seeks out justice for her, no matter the cost.

programme.title: Spiders 2
programme.desc: Rescued from a shipwreck, a couple soon falls prey to a deranged doctor who wants to use them as incubators for a giant spider's eggs.

programme.title: The Vault
programme.desc: Forced by desperate circumstances, two sisters rob a bank and are given instructions to check an old vault, where something dark resides.

programme.title: George A. Romero Presents: Deadtime Stories Volume 1
programme.desc: An anthology of horror tales depicts a woman searching for her husband in the jungles of South America, a man finding a jade box on a beach that holds something sinister, and a doctor finding -- during a house call -- a boy with a mysterious illness.

programme.title: Stonehearst Asylum
programme.desc: An Oxford University grad is horrified by the staff at a mental asylum he works for who are performing horrific and inhumane experimental treatments.

programme.title: Flight 666
programme.desc: Passengers and crew on an international flight are attacked by unseen forces that might be more or less deadly than one of their fellow travelers.

programme.title: The Pumpkin Karver
programme.desc: On the year anniversary that a man murdered his sisters boyfriend, who he thought was a masked Halloween killer, a real masked killer comes knocking.

programme.title: Wish Upon
programme.desc: After shes given a mysterious music box, Clare soon realizes that all her wishes are coming true. But theres a dark cost associated with each wish.

programme.title: Dead Awake
programme.desc: A woman who begins investigating the deaths of victims who suffered from sleep paralysis soon finds she must save herself from an ancient evil.

programme.title: House of Bones
programme.desc: A psychic and a team of TV ghost hunters travel to New Orleans to investigate a haunted house rumored to be the site of paranormal activity.

programme.title: An American Werewolf in Paris
programme.desc: An American tourist finds himself becoming involved with a French woman who also happens to be able to supernaturally turn into a werewolf.

programme.title: The Pit

programme.title: Charlie's Farm

programme.title: Curtains

programme.title: Spiders

programme.title: Dario Argento's Trauma (Broadcast Edit)

programme.title: Zoombies

programme.title: Rabid (1977)

programme.title: Donnie Darko (Director's Cut)
programme.desc: Sleepwalking, family drama, and strange visions of a doomsday-prophesying rabbit plague a troubled teenager in this mind-bending cult classic.

programme.title: Night of the Living Dead
programme.desc: A group of strangers struggle to fend off an attack of bloodthirsty zombies while barricading themselves inside a rural Pennsylvania farmhouse.

programme.title: Plan 9 From Outer Space
programme.desc: Residents of California's San Fernando Valley are under attack by flying saucers from outer space. The aliens, led by Eros (Dudley Manlove) and his assistant, Tanna (Joanna Lee), intend to conquer the planet by resurrecting corpses in a Hollywood cemetery. The living dead -- a cape-wearing ghoul (Bela Lugosi), a vampire (Vampira) and a slow-footed cop (Tor Johnson) who was killed for his nosiness -- stalk curious humans who wander into the cemetery looking for evidence of the UFOs.

programme.title: Nosferatu The Vampyre

programme.title: Black Christmas

programme.title: Day of the Dead
programme.desc: A group of scientists and soldiers take refuge in an underground missile silo desperate to control the flesh-eating horror roaming the earth above.

programme.title: The Exorcist III
programme.desc: A police lieutenant seeks answers in a psychiatric ward, when he ties a string of current murders to those of a serial killer executed long ago.

programme.title: Sleepaway Camp
programme.desc: Following the death of her family, Angela is sent to a camp for the summer. After her arrival, brutal accidents begin to kill the other campers.

programme.title: Mortuary
programme.desc: Christie Parson suspects her fathers recent drowning was no accident but, as she gets closer to the truth, she discovers a darker secret.

programme.title: Creepshow III
programme.desc: Macabre tales center on a strange radio, a killer call girl, a haunting, and more in this third installment in an iconic horror anthology series.

programme.title: The Taking of Deborah Logan
programme.desc: An elderly woman battling Alzheimer's agrees to let a film crew document her condition, but what they discover is something far more malevolent.

programme.title: Mutant
programme.desc: Two brothers vacationing in a tiny Southern town discover most of its residents have turned into mutant vampires prowling the streets for fresh blood.

programme.title: Silent Hill: Revelation
programme.desc: After spending years on the run with her father, Heather discovers her true identity, which has made her the target of a dangerous cult.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plants a mix of white flowers in the writing garden, demonstrates how to prune a climbing rose and reviews what's been happening in the vegetable garden. Adam Frost celebrates seasonal colour on a visit to a garden in Essex, and Sue Kent pots up allium bulbs in readiness for spring and replants a tricky border with lavender she's grown from cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don takes some practical steps to protect tender plants as the first frosts of the year begin to bite. He also starts preparing for next spring, planting tulips, pansies and apple trees and sharing his advice on training step-over apples and planting out wallflowers from seed. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is at Glebe Cottage demonstrating how to grow plants from cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes spring at Longmeadow with plenty of changes in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential pruning, he lifts and divides perennials, starts sowing chillies and begins growing this year's vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty harvests his favourite winter veg, Joe Swift discovers AJ Odudu's passion for houseplants, and Sue Kent and Toby Buckland take an inspirational trip to Piet Oudolf's garden in Somerset.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is at Longmeadow, preparing for the seasons to come. He demonstrates a quick and easy way to prune shrub roses and then plants up pots that will flower in time for Christmas. Grasses look their best at the end of summer and Carol Klein visits a garden in Somerset where they have been used to maximum effect on a sloping site with a range of soil conditions.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With Bonfire Night in mind, Monty Don turns his attention to the firecracker colours of spring when he begins to tidy up his herbaceous plants to make room to plant tulip bulbs. As well as recommending varieties for an early display, he also shows what to plant now under the shade of trees for colour next year.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives advice on the plants that need winter protection and thinks ahead to colourful spring bouquets. The glory of summer may be over in most gardens, but Carol goes to Worcestershire in search of some autumn colour.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the winter draws to a close, work in the garden starts to step up gear. With the flowers and fruits of summer in mind, Monty Don gets going by planting pots of summer bulbs for colour and scent, passing on his secrets of success by using a variety of planting techniques. He also reveals plans for reinvigorating the area in his garden where perennials are planted. Plus, Carol Klein visits Glendurgan Garden in Cornwall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the cottage garden, Monty is moving a rose which has outgrown its space and in the vegetable garden he gives advice on what to plant now for spring. He also finds out more about the mysterious world of earthworms and discovers why they are vital for the garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Frances Tophill and the team continue to celebrate the joy that the gardening year brings; Rachel de Thame visits Anglesey Abbey; Arit Anderson discovers how rewilding can increase biodiversity.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With Halloween just round the corner, Monty Don is harvesting his pumpkins and showing how to store them for roasts, soups and stews in the coming months. Joe Swift visits a high end garden in West London to get some tips on how clever landscaping and the use of lighting can turn a small space into an outdoor room which can be used all year round.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost demonstrates how to build a rose arch, mulches his beds and plants a blackcurrant to train up a fence. Frances Tophill visits RHS Wisley in Surrey to witness the seasonal colour that heathers can provide in the winter months.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is back at the helm, but this time in the garden at his own Herefordshire home - a place that he has lovingly nurtured for the last 20 years. With winter receding, Monty, Carol Klein, Joe Swift and Rachel de Thame are preparing for spring. As well as showing us round his garden, Monty lifts and divides snowdrops and sows beetroot and plants onions. Monty also prunes his apple trees and trims his shrub roses.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: After an extraordinary season, Monty's orchard has a bountiful harvest of apples and he gives advice on how to pick and store them. Frances Tophill makes a final visit to her shared allotment and joins in with the festivities at their annual show. Adam Frost visits the RHS garden Wisley where he meets the Curator to discuss the effects of summer. Nick Bailey investigates knotweed, one of the most pernicious weeds in the UK, Arit Anderson provides inspiration for colourful late season containers.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's the Easter weekend, which means extra time to get out and enjoy the garden. At Longmeadow, Monty plants out sweet peas for summer colour, gives advice on what to use for mulching borders and has plenty of ideas for jobs to get on with this long weekend. Carol Klein is at RHS Rosemoor to revel in the floral spring sensations that epitomise the season. In Scotland, JJ Chalmers explains how important his local park was in helping both his physical and mental rehabilitation.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets involved in more seasonal tasks at Longmeadow. Carol Klein celebrates the spring highlights at Beth Chatto's Gardens in Essex, and Toby Buckland is in Cornwall to meet a gardener who fell out of love with gardening.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: This time there's plenty to do to prepare for the season to come and Monty Don is clearing out spent crops and mulching his asparagus. Joe Swift's been to visit keen gardeners, Wayne and Geraldine Hemingway, to see how they combine sustainability with their designer-style. Carol Klein's exploring the history of the rose at Coughton Court, one of our best rose gardens and Monty plants a new rose of his own. What happens when you have to downsize and leave your much-loved garden?

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the clocks going forward this weekend, there's an extra hour of gardening to enjoy. Monty makes the most of this as he begins to sow dahlia seeds for summer flowers, reveals a new project and shows what to plant now in the vegetable garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty harvests his loofahs, plants tulip bulbs in pots, gives a masterclass in making leafmould and reflects on the gardening year.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the last programme of the current series, Monty Don takes stock of his year at Longmeadow. We visit RHS Wisley to learn why autumn leaves are such a precious commodity for our gardens, and in the final instalment of her botany series, Carol Klein celebrates the glorious displays put on by flowering plants to attract pollinators.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the team focus their attention on the loss of wildflower habitats in the UK and the part that gardeners can play in averting the resulting loss of wildlife. Adam Frost is in Lincolnshire to find out how crucial meadows are to supporting an ecosystem.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don prepares for his spring display and tackles slippery paths, Carol Klein visits a collection of Michaelmas daisies and we visit a veg grower with a show-stopping Halloween pumpkin.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty has tips and ideas for planting up garden pots to provide a focal point over the winter months, Rachel visits the tulips of Keukenhof, Joe visits Esther Rantzen's much-loved garden, and Carol visits Glebe Cottage.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty's in the jewel garden showing which plants need protection from the elements now and which ones can be left until after the first frosts. He also plants out berried shrubs to help feed wildlife in the winter, harvests pumpkins and shows how to make use of fallen autumnal leaves.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The programme comes from all four of the Royal Horticultural Society gardens, where the team are out on the road exploring how each location's differing climate affects the plants they grow. Carol Klein broadcasts from Wisley in Surrey. In the garden at Harlow Carr in Yorkshire, Joe Swift gets plenty of propagating tips. Rachel de Thame explores the gardens at Hyde Hall in Essex, and Monty Don visits Rosemoor in Devon.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Nick Bailey gets to grips with an unpromising patch of grass, and gives his tips on how to achieve a luscious lawn. We return to Adam Frost's garden as he starts to transform a herbaceous border and gives his advice on how to get rid of bindweed.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets going on planting herbs in his new herb garden and gives advice on how to divide and move ornamental grasses. Plus, meet the queen of herbs, Jekka McVicar, as she builds a herb garden at the Malvern Show.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: There is work to be done in and around the pond this week, and Monty also begins planting out his dahlias. Adding zing to the month of May is the euphorbia, and Carol Klein visits Oxford Botanic garden to view their extensive collection.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives advice on herbs which will grow happily in shade and has an unusual choice for his summer containers, bananas. Earlier this year, Monty paid a visit to Chatsworth House to find out about the history of the extensive grounds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty adds a touch of the exotic to the damp garden by planting a tree fern, and protects his new soft fruit garden from feathered predators with netting. Also Carol Klein selects hardy geraniums as her June `Plant of the Month'.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: One couple battle to turn a clay-clogged building site in Sussex into a piece of Portugal. Another tackle a forest of overgrowth in their new back garden in Cadeby. They are determined to create a productive space, something they have always wanted.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: A truck driver from Wakefield with a passion for flowers wants to create a perfect outside space for his girlfriend and burgeoning family, while in Swindon a widow wants to find the best way of turning her bleak patch of green into a cottage garden.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty travels to two corners of the country where the challenges he faces are very different. On the south coast he is presented with a front garden ravaged by salty winds, and in Snowdonia he helps a mountainside garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is at Longmeadow sharing a wealth of tips and ideas on how to keep your garden looking good all year long. He tackles some urgent pruning, and reveals some of the projects he's got in store over the coming months.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Hellebores, the jewels of the early spring border, come under the spotlight on this show. Monty Don shares his top tips on how to get the best from them. Carol Klein visits a couple who have just moved into a bungalow with a badly neglected garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don explains why he thinks that the once-popular chrysanthemum is worth revisiting and Joe Swift has some helpful suggestions if you're thinking of giving your garden a bit of a spring revamp.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don plants up a new bed of asparagus and shows us how to lift and divide hostas. On our second visit to South Africa, we explore the conditions that allow agapanthus to thrive in the wild.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty Don breaks ground for his new pond and Carol Klein pays Geoff and Sally Davis another visit in their Somerset garden. Their overgrown shrubs are in need of a jolly good haircut, but they haven't a clue where to begin.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the weather begins to warm up, there's plenty to be getting on with in the garden. Monty Don welcomes us to Longmeadow and cracks on with some timely tasks. Including Water Iris Garden, Peonies, Seaside Garden, National Gardening Week.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels from Missouri to Chicago and then across to New York and Philadelphia. He begins his journey in a prairie, the original American flowering wilderness. Much of the prairie has disappeared but he meets a couple who have revived the tradition and enjoy showing it to him in full bloom.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty explores the extraordinary scenery of the west coast of America. He begins his journey in Arizona where he learns about cacti and marvels at the sight of them in the desert and in private gardens where they have replaced traditional plants and lawns.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels from the north west coast of Scotland to the north east coast of England, from historic reconstructions to modern re-inventions. He visits some of the most inhospitable places in the country and finds gardens that are flourishing.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across some of the country's landscapes, heading across the north of England to Northern Ireland. Here, Monty sees the ingenuity, passion and determination of British people to garden and create gardens, no matter what the canvas.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across the middle of the country, from Wales to Norfolk. He comes across gardens for gnomes, much-loved, well-tended allotments and extravagant gardens that bankrupted their owners.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the most densely populated part of the country, London and the home counties. He visits some of London's gardens, including a special one on a barge, as well as a beautifully restored garden close to where he grew up in Hampshire.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across the south west of the country to visit some of Britain's most exotic gardens. On this journey, Monty also goes to some of the country's most historic gardens, as well as some challenging contemporary ones.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty helps two families create dream gardens that are as much for the children as for the adults. In Doncaster, Nikki and John want a garden full of edible plants and fruit.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Rachel de Thame joins Monty in Longmeadow and adds more medicinal planting to the herb garden, especially those that the bees love. Rachel also investigates how we can aid honey bee conservation and protect the nation's favourite pollinators.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Join Will Cooper on an unforgettable adventure in the Colorado mountains, where he dedicated three years chasing elusive bull elk without success. Determined to turn the tide, Will enlists the expertise of his good friend Jermaine Hodge, prior World Elk Calling Champion and Wrestling Coach for the United States Army World Class Athlete Program. Together, they face challenges and overcome adversity during a thrilling public land over-the-counter rifle hunt. Experience the highs and lows of their journey against the stunning backdrop of Colorado's wilderness.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: In the wide world of western big game, pronghorn antelope hunting in Wyoming is unmatched in its accessibility and excitement. Its an active pursuit, typically ripe with plenty of opportunities to spot and stalk black-horned bucks. This makes it an ideal forum for riflemen looking to scratch their western itch.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Jeff Lindsey from The Lindsey Way is on a mission for one deer a buck they call Junior. After passing him the year before, Jeff spends months trying to catch up with the elusive whitetail. He makes mistakes, second-guesses himself, and faces plenty of close calls. But exactly one year to the day after letting Junior walk, Jeff climbs back into the same stand and this time, it all comes together.

programme.title: Bearded Buck
programme.desc: In this episode, we're headed out to Oklahoma to follow along with the Sharp brothers as they hunt whitetails in their home state. You never know what to expect with these two but one thing you can always rely on is that they always have some big deer to go after!

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Heading to one of the great wilderness areas of North America, Dan Cabela is in search of Stone Sheep in British Columbia. Joining scientists, they embark on an ambitious conservation project to help conserve this incredible species.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Realtree crew heads north to Alberta for an early jump on the 2025 waterfowl season. Teaming up with Black Jack Outfitters, Cole Barthel joins forces with Rusty Creasey, Dr. Duck, and Billy Campbell for an unforgettable first morning in the dry fields of Canada.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Team Realtree travels back to Arkansas and joins Rusty Creasey to hunt late season ducks.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Realtree teams us with Aurora Skies Outfitting for another Canadian waterfowl hunt. Ducks and geese are diving into the decoys from all directions, and the barrels are heating up fast.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Realtree's Cole Barthel compares the performance of the High Flyer Series of Kicks choke tubes to help you determine which one is best for your duck hunting scenario.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Realtree Crew continues their action-packed waterfowl hunt in Canada as the guys try to pull a few snow geese into the decoys.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Timber duck hunts may be the most exciting way to hunt ducks! With strange conditions following the opening of the second split, Cole and the Black Cloud crew struggle to find ducks. Luckily a good friend has a pocket of Timber that is holding birds and invites the guys along for a shoot.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Team Realtree wraps up their trip to Canada with some of their harvest on the grill. Which tastes better, Sandhill Crane or Speckle Belly?

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: To kill ducks late season, you need to get off the grid and "FIND THE X". Realtree's Cole Barthel, Kyle Barefield, Stephen McNelly and Producer Matt Garger do exactly that. Hunting Ducks from a boat won't be easy but their struggles are well worth their while.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Will Cooper finally trades 3 years of tough times for triumph in his quest to tag an out-of-state buck with a bow.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Josh Dahlke grabs a TenPoint crossbow and kicks back on "Island Time," along with the Nashville rockers from Loose Lips.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Join Captain Josh and Sheriff Eric Aden for a day of fishing and fun in Destin, Florida. These two friends hit the water, catching fish both offshore and inshore, and reeling in some impressive catches. With plenty of laughs, great stories, and a few surprises along the way, this episode is all about the joy of fishing and the bond between two guys who love the sea.

programme.title: Flats Class

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Justin and Meredith return to the chase after taking a lesson from finicky tarpon. This time, they pay close attention to how hooks and presentations affect their odds of a strike.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Todd Jones jumps on Justins boat for a sight fishing dream day. After success along the beach, they turn to handlining for Goliath grouper and witness the amazing survival saga of the worlds luckiest fish.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We join Denny McMahan on this episode at the legendary Thumbtack Ranch in South Texas. Denny was nominated by his wife for Bucks for the Brave program hosted by Trinity Oaks. After dedicating his life to service in the US Army and law enforcement, he now continues the mission by teaching at the police academy. Denny is a true hero in his community - someone who sacrifices his time, his well being, and his life in service to others, never asking for anything in return.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: This is the story of how FE Hill ranch got it's start. From its inception, FE Hill has created opportunities for people to experience the outdoors and create memories. For us, it has created a tradition of Fathers and Sons hunting together.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Part II of our exclusive profile of the current state of hunting in America and whether or not we believe there is light at the end of the tunnel.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over 70 years ago, John Olin took 600 acres of farmland joined by timber and turned it into a wildlife oasis in hopes of creating an ideal place to raise and train the best Labradors Retrievers in the country. He called it Nilo, which was also Olins model of conservation. Today, Nilo is still considered one of the most prestigious hunting and shooting preserves in the nation. This is the story of Nilo.

programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Florida Keys guide Jeff Malone to find a frenzy of exciting Bluefish near Marathon, FL.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: Blair and Leiza Fitzgerrald search the Indian River Lagoon for redfish to tag for the CCA STAR Tournament.

programme.title: We Caught That
programme.desc: Capt. Jason Dozier teams up with Capt. David Paycheck for a day of firsts. Jason tries a new style of bass fishing with David, and then introduces David to hunting Moorhen for the first time.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Odyssea Sportfishing family grows as Casey Villone comes aboard as Rush's new deck hand. While Rush gained a helping hand on his charters, he also scored a new "Fishing Mate" who is always game to bend a rod. With a day off and a report of Tuna offshore, the two head out to see if they can beat the sharks and land a Key West sushi dinner.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Rush teams up with longtime friend and fellow angler Jesus Diaz for a well-earned "busman's holiday" in the beautiful waters of Key West. Even on a day off, these two can't resist seeing what's going to bite. Taking the wind and the tides into account, the duo maps out a strategic circuit through Key West's surrounding waters to target cobia, grouper, snapper, and tuna for a busy day "off" work.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Water quality is everythingand the Star brite - SeaSafe team is back at it for the second year in a row! Led by Cory Redwine, Conservation Director of Project SeaSafe, this is the 4th Annual Clean Water Collective and its bigger than ever. This time, were in Grant, Florida, where 4 million clams are being released into the Indian River Lagoon, paired with the planting of thousands of mangroves, oyster work by CCA and trash clean ups to help restore one of Floridas most critical ecosystems. But its not just about hard workits about connection. With local captains, fishing legends, and the Local Knowledge crew on hand, we hit the water to show why this place is worth fighting for. From clam drops by drone, to in-water mangrove planting, to monster snook catches, this is hands-on conservation at its best. This two-part series kicks off with action, heart, and the kind of hope only a healthy waterway can bring. Dont miss Part 1where conservation meets community and everyone gets their hands wet.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: As part of this year's Star brite Sea Safe event, we hit the water to experience some of the incredible fishing the Indian River Lagoon has to offer. For Rush, that meant some serious bow time with close friend Alex Hughey - on the hunt for some of the biggest snook we've ever encountered. The bite wasn't easy, but that didn't stop Rush from smashing his personal best - not once, but twice - in one unforgettable day on the water. Don't miss this action-packed episode of the Sea Safe adventure from beautiful Sebastian, Florida!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Slade and Caleb head back to Missouri to catch the end of bow season,and the start of rifle. Slade arrows a great buck (twice), and we preview the latest property Slade & Co. purchased in MO.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade takes us through his new investment property, and breaks downwhats involved in taking a raw land tract and creating extremely desirable turn-keyhunting properties.Caleb and Slade double up on some Wilkinson County gobblers for Calebs first turkeykill ever.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: The "Trained Assassins" are back and its turkey season in the Midwest. In this first episode, Slade, Blake, and Ryan start in Missouri, run into some trouble, but end up getting it done on the first leg of the 2024 turkey tour.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode Slade takes Bentley on his very first duck hunt. Slade also gets to take a trip to duck hunting paradise with some great buddies of his. This episode is all about having a great time with great friends.

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: CA takes his Son Cam to the Sports Coast for some friendly Father Son competition.

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: How do you catch a persnickety Redfish? One bite at a time.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: When it comes to fishing in Key West, you can often get a lot done in a little bit of time. After an early check in to Oceans Edge Resort and a mid day departure from then dock, Ali looks to Rush to put him on an afternoon bite of tuna and bottom fish that few other places can offer. If Rush is going to deliver, he will need to make a plan and stick to it to make the best use of this limited time.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: For Ali and Rush, one of the best aspects of fishing is being able to share experiences on the water with interesting people. On this episode we invite luxury watch enthusiast Eric Rivera - AKA "Watch Eric" to the Florida Keys to target Permit and Amberjack in the Gulf.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Featuring Capt. Sammy Millazo Fishing Offshore Islamorada.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: From Miami to Apalachicola Bay, Florida, Capt. Jonathan Moss revisits some of his favorite moments from this season.

programme.title: Sportsman's Journal
programme.desc: Lake Vermilion is home to some amazing fishing opportunities with crappies being one of them!

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Captain Jonathan Moss travels to Melbourne, on Floridas Space Coast, to cast flies with Capt. Noah Miler at some unforgettable fish.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: We follow along as a decommissioned ship is sunk to create a new artificial reef, much to the delight of divers and anglers. Plus, Adapt-Able SCUBA makes underwater adventure possible for those who didnt think it was.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: A beautiful beach day and confident anglers is the perfect scenario to prove tarpon never play by the rules. Justin & Meredith get a dose of tarpon psychology and begin to second guess their angling skills.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Justin and Meredith return to the chase after taking a lesson from finicky tarpon. This time, they pay close attention to how hooks and presentations affect their odds of a strike.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Todd Jones jumps on Justins boat for a sight fishing dream day. After success along the beach, they turn to handlining for Goliath grouper and witness the amazing survival saga of the worlds luckiest fish.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 2: New Orleans, Josh links up with Mason Hereford (owner of award-winning sandwich shop Turkey and the Wolf) and then hits the road for some epic hog hunting, swamp fishing, crawfish and oyster harvesting, and exploring Louisianas only water buffalo dairy farm. It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 3, Josh starts off in the Twin Cities where he meets up with Yia Vang, an award-winning Hmong chef and restaurant owner, bringing his familys traditions and flavors to the American Midwest. As Josh heads up north to Duluth and the boundary waters, hell meet plenty of farmers and foragersharvesting mushrooms, wild rice, and catching a few fish (and waves) along the way. It all wraps up with an epic feast hosted by Yia back in the cities.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Capt. Scott Walker and Capt. Steve Rodger meet up with Capt. Brain Wilson in Galveston, TX for a taste of what the Texas Gulf Coast has to offer.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Capt. Scott Walker and Capt. Steve Rodger join Capt. Brain Wilson in Galveston, TX for some hot Red Snapper action.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Capt. Scott Walker and Capt. Steve Rodger go north for a change to sight fish tripletails in Florida Bay.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Capt. Scott Walker and Capt. Steve Rodger head to the hump on a windy day to target tunas and find some bonus mahis and tripletails as well.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Being consistently productive on the water means knowing how to adapt to conditions. Capt. Scott Walker and Capt. Steve Rodger switch it up and fish shallow for sailfish.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Capt. Scott Walker and Capt. Steve Rodger launch from the incomparable Oceans Edge Resort in Key West, Florida to hunt down all kinds of sport fish.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: In rural Wisconsin, we follow the Yackley family who has dedicated their lives to competitive shooting. The five-member crew is the most decorated family in shooting sports. Becky Yackley gives tips to new shooters and then teams up with Chris Keefer to review Winchester USA Ready.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over 70 years ago, John Olin took 600 acres of farmland joined by timber and turned it into a wildlife oasis in hopes of creating an ideal place to raise and train the best Labradors Retrievers in the country. He called it Nilo, which was also Olins model of conservation. Today, Nilo is still considered one of the most prestigious hunting and shooting preserves in the nation. This is the story of Nilo.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The story of the game changing 350 Legend cartridge is documented at deer camps across the midwest with the Keefer Brothers in Kansas, Mark and Terry Drury in Missouri, Melissa Bachman in Nebraska and Team Winchester back in Missouri.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The collaboration story between Winchester and Browning to create the groundbreaking 6.8 Western is featured. Tag along on a mule deer hunt in Utah with Chris Keefer and Winchesters Jason Gilbertson, then follow Casey Keefer to Colorado for elk and Nebraska for whitetail where the 6.8 Western is put to the test.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Capt. Jared and Father-Son duo Captains Hunter & Chris Barron have Sailfish in their sights.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Capt. Jared travels to Venice, Louisiana, where the Mississippi River meets the Gulf, joining Capt. Garrett George and Capt. Jesse Leboeuf for an action-packed offshore adventure in pursuit of Redfish and Tuna.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Capt. Jared joins his best new bud, Capt. Garrett George for a summertime Mahi bash.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Jared's teams up with long time friend and fellow guide, Capt. Greg Dini, to conquer the patch reef.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over a decade after the game changing Longbeard XR was introduced by Winchester, the wait is finally over for their next ground breaking turkey load. After years of perfecting the recipe behind the scenes, Winchester finally unveiled the new Longbeard TSS at a turkey camp in northern Michigan. First watch the jaw dropping Longbeard TSS pattern board testing, then see it go to work on some spring gobblers.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nestled in the hills of Ohio just west of the Appalachians is a very special deer camp ripe with memories from deer seasons past. With the development of the 350 Legend straight-walled cartridge by Winchester in 2019, a world of opportunities now existed in states like Ohio and Michigan. In this episode, with the 350 Legend in hand, three mature whitetails meet their maker, from the same blind, over the course of three seasons.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Its been 60 years since AA Tracker was introduced to the shooting sports world. Since that day, an immeasurable number of AA hulls have hit the ground and countless shooters have stood center stage raising a trophy where millions of dollars have been won. Professional and recreational shooters alike have trusted AA for six decades. In this episode, load up for stories of high school, collegiate competitors and the worlds best as they bust clays with the legendary shot shell.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: For the first time in history, the World English Sporting Clays Championship was held in the United States at the incredible M&M Hunting Preserve owned by the Matarese family in New Jersey. Watch as Winchesters best shooters vie for Gold as they compete against over 2,500 shooters and 17 countries. Well also join the Kids and Clays foundation in Florida as they host an event that will most certainly touch your soul.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: In this episode the DCD crew heads to the lesser-known but highly productive Red River in Western Louisiana. Despite a slow start to the season, the Red River provides some of the best hunting yet. With mixed bags of woodies, greenheads, and teal. Not to mention a handful of bonus squirrels and wild mushrooms. Shoot straight and come hungry.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: Duck hunting in Louisiana is as much about its history as it is about its future. In the season's final days, Jean-Paul learns about Louisianas rich waterfowling history, dives into conservation projects throughout the state, and returns to Bayou Black for one last ride. Shoot straight and come hungry because it's the last hunt of the season.

programme.title: Local Lines
programme.desc: Capt Brandon visits Quails Landing Plantation in South Georgia and his buddy Steven Redrick to do all things outdoors.

programme.title: Local Lines
programme.desc: Brandon fishes with Robbie Crosnoe On Lake Henderson. These longtime buddies are dialed into the lake like no one else.

programme.title: Local Lines
programme.desc: Capt. Brandon Branch, Steve Grant and Kelly Player leave Jacksonville, FL for the Gulfstream to get into some Mahi.

programme.title: Local Lines
programme.desc: Brandon fishes an insane grouper bite with his good buddy from Sodium Fishing Gear.

programme.title: Sportsman's Journal
programme.desc: Sara and Tyler head to Cliff Lake Resorts in NW Ontario for big walleyes using a drop shot technique!

programme.title: Sportsman's Journal
programme.desc: Sara and Tyler head to Tamarack Island on Lake of the Woods! The crappies are starting to stage and Northlands new Tungsten Crappie King Fly is on the menu.

programme.title: Sportsman's Journal
programme.desc: Tyler is joined by professional rod builder Erik Kraemer from Kraemer Custom rods. They discuss critical concepts of choosing the right fishing rod while chasing walleyes in Northern Wisconsin!

programme.title: Sportsman's Journal
programme.desc: Another trip to Tamarack Island and another unreal fishing experience! This time we unfold the map to main lake mud flats for big Lake of the Woods crappies!

programme.title: Beyond The Surface
programme.desc: Today, Capt. Danny is joined by his son Dillan for a plug-filled day in their local waters of Cedar Key, FL!

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: CAs skiff gets an upgrade. Now no fish is safe.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Join Will Cooper on an unforgettable adventure in the Colorado mountains, where he dedicated three years chasing elusive bull elk without success. Determined to turn the tide, Will enlists the expertise of his good friend Jermaine Hodge, prior World Elk Calling Champion and Wrestling Coach for the United States Army World Class Athlete Program. Together, they face challenges and overcome adversity during a thrilling public land over-the-counter rifle hunt. Experience the highs and lows of their journey against the stunning backdrop of Colorado's wilderness.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: In the wide world of western big game, pronghorn antelope hunting in Wyoming is unmatched in its accessibility and excitement. Its an active pursuit, typically ripe with plenty of opportunities to spot and stalk black-horned bucks. This makes it an ideal forum for riflemen looking to scratch their western itch.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Jeff Lindsey from The Lindsey Way is on a mission for one deer a buck they call Junior. After passing him the year before, Jeff spends months trying to catch up with the elusive whitetail. He makes mistakes, second-guesses himself, and faces plenty of close calls. But exactly one year to the day after letting Junior walk, Jeff climbs back into the same stand and this time, it all comes together.

programme.title: Bearded Buck
programme.desc: In this episode, we're headed out to Oklahoma to follow along with the Sharp brothers as they hunt whitetails in their home state. You never know what to expect with these two but one thing you can always rely on is that they always have some big deer to go after!

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Heading to one of the great wilderness areas of North America, Dan Cabela is in search of Stone Sheep in British Columbia. Joining scientists, they embark on an ambitious conservation project to help conserve this incredible species.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Realtree crew heads north to Alberta for an early jump on the 2025 waterfowl season. Teaming up with Black Jack Outfitters, Cole Barthel joins forces with Rusty Creasey, Dr. Duck, and Billy Campbell for an unforgettable first morning in the dry fields of Canada.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Team Realtree travels back to Arkansas and joins Rusty Creasey to hunt late season ducks.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Realtree teams us with Aurora Skies Outfitting for another Canadian waterfowl hunt. Ducks and geese are diving into the decoys from all directions, and the barrels are heating up fast.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Realtree's Cole Barthel compares the performance of the High Flyer Series of Kicks choke tubes to help you determine which one is best for your duck hunting scenario.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Realtree Crew continues their action-packed waterfowl hunt in Canada as the guys try to pull a few snow geese into the decoys.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Timber duck hunts may be the most exciting way to hunt ducks! With strange conditions following the opening of the second split, Cole and the Black Cloud crew struggle to find ducks. Luckily a good friend has a pocket of Timber that is holding birds and invites the guys along for a shoot.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Team Realtree wraps up their trip to Canada with some of their harvest on the grill. Which tastes better, Sandhill Crane or Speckle Belly?

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: To kill ducks late season, you need to get off the grid and "FIND THE X". Realtree's Cole Barthel, Kyle Barefield, Stephen McNelly and Producer Matt Garger do exactly that. Hunting Ducks from a boat won't be easy but their struggles are well worth their while.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Will Cooper finally trades 3 years of tough times for triumph in his quest to tag an out-of-state buck with a bow.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Josh Dahlke grabs a TenPoint crossbow and kicks back on "Island Time," along with the Nashville rockers from Loose Lips.

programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor take Sergeant Major (r) Jamey Caldwell fishing out of Hawks Cay for some grouper and tarpon action in the Florida Keys.

programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor meet up with Captain Nick LaBadie at Big Pine Key for an action packed day on the flats chasing tarpon, bonefish and permit for the elusive grand slam.

programme.desc: Mike heads to the plantation on Crystal River to fish with Dallas King For trout and redfish.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Captain Jonathan Moss looks back at some memorable entries from Season 6 of The Captains Log.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Join Captain Josh and Sheriff Eric Aden for a day of fishing and fun in Destin, Florida. These two friends hit the water, catching fish both offshore and inshore, and reeling in some impressive catches. With plenty of laughs, great stories, and a few surprises along the way, this episode is all about the joy of fishing and the bond between two guys who love the sea.

programme.desc: Capt. Jared Raskob and Capt. Mike Alfano have a big surprise for Mikes Dad, Randy.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We join Denny McMahan on this episode at the legendary Thumbtack Ranch in South Texas. Denny was nominated by his wife for Bucks for the Brave program hosted by Trinity Oaks. After dedicating his life to service in the US Army and law enforcement, he now continues the mission by teaching at the police academy. Denny is a true hero in his community - someone who sacrifices his time, his well being, and his life in service to others, never asking for anything in return.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: This is the story of how FE Hill ranch got it's start. From its inception, FE Hill has created opportunities for people to experience the outdoors and create memories. For us, it has created a tradition of Fathers and Sons hunting together.

programme.desc: Capt. Todd Jones jumps on Justins boat for a sight fishing dream day. After success along the beach, they turn to handlining for Goliath grouper and witness the amazing survival saga of the worlds luckiest fish.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 2: New Orleans, Josh links up with Mason Hereford (owner of award-winning sandwich shop Turkey and the Wolf) and then hits the road for some epic hog hunting, swamp fishing, crawfish and oyster harvesting, and exploring Louisianas only water buffalo dairy farm. It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 3, Josh starts off in the Twin Cities where he meets up with Yia Vang, an award-winning Hmong chef and restaurant owner, bringing his familys traditions and flavors to the American Midwest. As Josh heads up north to Duluth and the boundary waters, hell meet plenty of farmers and foragersharvesting mushrooms, wild rice, and catching a few fish (and waves) along the way. It all wraps up with an epic feast hosted by Yia back in the cities.

programme.title: Into The Blue

programme.title: Into The Blue

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: In rural Wisconsin, we follow the Yackley family who has dedicated their lives to competitive shooting. The five-member crew is the most decorated family in shooting sports. Becky Yackley gives tips to new shooters and then teams up with Chris Keefer to review Winchester USA Ready.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over 70 years ago, John Olin took 600 acres of farmland joined by timber and turned it into a wildlife oasis in hopes of creating an ideal place to raise and train the best Labradors Retrievers in the country. He called it Nilo, which was also Olins model of conservation. Today, Nilo is still considered one of the most prestigious hunting and shooting preserves in the nation. This is the story of Nilo.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The story of the game changing 350 Legend cartridge is documented at deer camps across the midwest with the Keefer Brothers in Kansas, Mark and Terry Drury in Missouri, Melissa Bachman in Nebraska and Team Winchester back in Missouri.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The collaboration story between Winchester and Browning to create the groundbreaking 6.8 Western is featured. Tag along on a mule deer hunt in Utah with Chris Keefer and Winchesters Jason Gilbertson, then follow Casey Keefer to Colorado for elk and Nebraska for whitetail where the 6.8 Western is put to the test.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Capt. Jared and Father-Son duo Captains Hunter & Chris Barron have Sailfish in their sights.

programme.title: Sail Kings

programme.title: Sail Kings

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Jared's teams up with long time friend and fellow guide, Capt. Greg Dini, to conquer the patch reef.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over a decade after the game changing Longbeard XR was introduced by Winchester, the wait is finally over for their next ground breaking turkey load. After years of perfecting the recipe behind the scenes, Winchester finally unveiled the new Longbeard TSS at a turkey camp in northern Michigan. First watch the jaw dropping Longbeard TSS pattern board testing, then see it go to work on some spring gobblers.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nestled in the hills of Ohio just west of the Appalachians is a very special deer camp ripe with memories from deer seasons past. With the development of the 350 Legend straight-walled cartridge by Winchester in 2019, a world of opportunities now existed in states like Ohio and Michigan. In this episode, with the 350 Legend in hand, three mature whitetails meet their maker, from the same blind, over the course of three seasons.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Its been 60 years since AA Tracker was introduced to the shooting sports world. Since that day, an immeasurable number of AA hulls have hit the ground and countless shooters have stood center stage raising a trophy where millions of dollars have been won. Professional and recreational shooters alike have trusted AA for six decades. In this episode, load up for stories of high school, collegiate competitors and the worlds best as they bust clays with the legendary shot shell.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: For the first time in history, the World English Sporting Clays Championship was held in the United States at the incredible M&M Hunting Preserve owned by the Matarese family in New Jersey. Watch as Winchesters best shooters vie for Gold as they compete against over 2,500 shooters and 17 countries. Well also join the Kids and Clays foundation in Florida as they host an event that will most certainly touch your soul.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: In this episode the DCD crew heads to the lesser-known but highly productive Red River in Western Louisiana. Despite a slow start to the season, the Red River provides some of the best hunting yet. With mixed bags of woodies, greenheads, and teal. Not to mention a handful of bonus squirrels and wild mushrooms. Shoot straight and come hungry.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: Duck hunting in Louisiana is as much about its history as it is about its future. In the season's final days, Jean-Paul learns about Louisianas rich waterfowling history, dives into conservation projects throughout the state, and returns to Bayou Black for one last ride. Shoot straight and come hungry because it's the last hunt of the season.

But Billy has a head start, and his crew of outlaws is growing by the minute.

When a dire situation during a storm forces the executive officer (Van Johnson) to relieve Queeg of his duties, he and Ensign Keith are tried for mutiny.

Jones is hired by a newspaper to write about Mannion and starts dating Wilhelmina Clark (Jean Arthur). However, when Jones returns home one night, Mannion is waiting and demands the note so that he can roam freely.

programme.title: Bell, Book and Candle

programme.title: Twentieth Century

However, Lily, along with her new beau, George (Ralph Forbes), and Jaffe's rival producer, Max Jacobs (Charles Levison), who hired Lily to star in his latest play, have other plans.

programme.title: Anatomy of a Murder
programme.desc: Semi-retired Michigan lawyer Paul Biegler (James Stewart) takes the case of Army Lt. Manion (Ben Gazzara), who murdered a local innkeeper after his wife (Lee Remick) claimed that he raped her. Over the course of an extensive trial, Biegler parries with District Attorney Lodwick (Brooks West) and out-of-town prosecutor Claude Dancer (George C. Scott) to set his client free, but his case rests on the victim's mysterious business partner (Kathryn Grant), who's hiding a dark secret.

After narrowly surviving an attack from Scavo and his men, Stewart has little choice but to fight back in order to save both his ranch and his family, including nephew Howie (Skip Homeier).

Robinson), the scheming businessman interested in his property, make Parrish reconsider the move, especially after one of his ranch hands is murdered. Adding to the increasingly tense conflict is Wilkison's wife, Martha (Barbara Stanwyck), who is cheating on her husband with his brother, Cole (Brian Keith).

Thinking that the British are behind the attack, Kasim wages war against them. A jealous cowhand (Rod Steiger) complicates matters by spreading lies.
